Latest News

  1. Stay up to date

  1. FY2020 Proposed Budget

    Fiscal Year 2020 (July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2020) Find out more...

  2. Keep York County Beautiful

    Please consider joining Adopt -A-Spot, York County’s community cleanup effort. A perfect community service project for individuals, families, groups, and organizations that love York County and want to help the environment. Find out more...

  3. Calling all Teens ages 13-16!

    Learn to be a historical interpreter at a living history Museum - Application Deadline is March 22. Read on...

  4. Senior Center of York's March Activities

    A variety of educational and entertaining programs are being offered. Participation is open to seniors age 55 or better and their spouses, regardless of age. Find out more...

  5. Yorktown's FREE Trolley Returns Friday, March 22

    The new 2019 schedule even includes new concert runs Find out more...

  6. Board of Supervisors Work Session - Proposed FY2020 Budget

    Watch the BOS Meeting LIVE, Tuesday, March 26 at 6 pm. Watch LIVE

  7. Be A Part Of The Plan

    Addressing land use, transportation, affordable housing, public facilities, sea level rise/recurrent flooding, etc. Additional Info...

  8. Learn how to attract beautiful pollinators

    Register for the Free Native Plant Forum on April 6 - the event also features an inspired documentary "Hometown Habitat" Register here...

  9. Scramble for eggs through New Quarter Park

    Register now for the April 13 Easter Egg Scramble - Registration closes Friday, April 5. Find out more...

  10. Extra! Extra!

    Read the Spring Edition of Citizen News Read on...

  11. Coming this Spring....Wormley Creek Landing Improvements!

    Facility Closed Now through March 31 - Upgrades include an ADA accessible kayak launch system. Find out more...
